short_description: This tropical paradise off the coast of Africa is a nature lover's dream come true. Spot lemurs in the rainforest, snorkel in crystal- clear waters, and relax on some of the world's most beautiful beaches

tipping.hotels: Tipping is expected from tourists at around 2000 Ar per bag for porters and 2000 Ar per day for housekeeping
tipping.guides: Tipping isn't obligatory but it's expected. Tip the guide 15,000-20,000 Ar and 5,000-10,000Ar per day for driver
tipping.restaurants: No tip is needed if service charge is added. If not, add 10% to your bill as standard
tipping.taxis: Tipping your taxi driver in Madagascar is not required but you could round up to show appreciation

weather.title: Madagascar has a tropical climate with high temperatures and humidity year-round. It experiences a wet season from November to April, characterized by heavy rainfall, while the dry season from May to October offers drier conditions. The country is known for its unique biodiversity and diverse ecosystems

when_to_visit.title: Dry season
when_to_visit.short_description: Pleasant weather conditions and lower rainfall. Perfect for outdoor exploration and activities

when_to_visit.title: Baobab in bloom
when_to_visit.short_description: Peak tourist season when baobab trees are in full bloom, creating stunning photo opportunities

when_to_visit.title: Lemur sightings
when_to_visit.time_period: April and May, October and November
when_to_visit.short_description: Warm temperatures, lush landscapes and fewer tourists. Great time to see the island's unique flora and fauna, including baby lemurs emerging from their nests

when_to_visit.title: Wet season
when_to_visit.short_description: Heavy rainfall and high humidity. Some areas will be inaccessible during this period

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Madagascar depends on the region, but generally, the months of April to November offer milder temperatures, less rainfall, and better wildlife viewing opportunities
